column5: Finally got to take my new ride out for some fishing yesterday morning on Lake O.  We didn't catch anything, it was my first time rigging it up and with the aweful weather moving in expectations were not very high.  It was a great morning out though, no wind and amazingly calm waters.  The fog was insane though and we would've been in trouble without my handheld GPS and IPhone as backup (will be upgrading the finder next year but for now toughing it out with what I have).  Anyways on to some pictures!   Getting ready to launch   Heading out   Me behind the wheel   The track system installed and rigged   Canopy up and my buddy driving.  Didn't really need it for the rain but it sure helped a ton keeping the fish flies off.  They COVERED the entire boat.   Fish flies swarming   Hopefully we get some nice weather and some warmer temps to get the kings biting on the north shore soon.  I need to get her slimed up
that is one old school rod!
That rod looks like a Burt Dam special
Ya it was my stepdad's who recently passed.  Trying to get one on it for him.
Here's wishing for your biggest of the year on it
Thanks!
Nice Boat.

saw an episode of fishin' canada yesterday and he was fishing right next to the power plant.  caught a monster carp there.  then he went into frenchman's and hooked a couple of pike and one was a really nice size.  I might try the bay out this season but probably not over by the plant.
Nice!
Many years of great memories starting with that rig!!! Good to see your step father's rod in a holder, what a great way to launch the new ship !
Very nice looking Ride.I like the new stylish decals on your Legend
nice ride
nice, nice, nice and nice.  Great post.  PS, If you need a 'net-man' I'm in Brooklin...
sweet ride Adam -
Congrats on your brand new Legend 19 Xcalibur.  I hope the memories are bigger than the fish!
Nice boat, keep us up to date with Legend's service. How did you like the sell and steps from there dealer?
Really nice Ride AA. That first ride in her is a Magical feeling eh  Be safe, and tite lines Bud !!!  Paul
YEP YOU DA KING 2DAY!!!  Sweet boat!!!
Nothing beats the first ride in a new rig, your smile say it all!!!  Enjoy
Nice machine!  Im sure you will have many many hours of memories on it!
wow what a pretty set up you got there!  cheers!

Very nice looking rig . should give you years of great fishing. Just one thing I would keep your rod tips up a little our your going to loose a rod.  Soon as a fish hits or on a snag your rod could go bye bye. just a thought. GOOD LUCK  SIR.

Thanks all!  Geoff I work shift work so I may be looking for a partner the odd weekday if you are around....  Mike there were a couple minor issues...I will send ya a pm.  Paul thanks, not sure if I congratulated you on yours yet but congrats as well!  I am jealous you got some slime in yours already  mrpike thanks for the concern, the cannon rod holder it's in is designed for that.  It's pretty deep in there so I am not really too worried.   Hopefully I will see some of you out on the waters this summer, if you see me stop and say hi!  AA.
Nice ride!! Enjoy her!! She'll get some slime on'er soon enough!!
